page.title: 19Racing Stables
page.content:
In recent years Norton-on-Derwent has become famous as a centre for training race horses and this has earned it the title of the "Newmarket of the North". The connection with racing dates back to 1736 and although nationally known as "Malton" trainers, nearly all of them are located in Norton-on-Derwent.
Some of the most spirited horses in the country have, or are, trained over the gallops at the Langton Wold and Highfield training grounds on the edge of Wolds. It is a common sight to see race horses being exercised around the town and each morning strings of race horses can be seen through the town as they are taken from their stables to the training areas.
Horse racing is not carried on in the town.
